title: [K-12] Self-Efficacy-Based Project Learning for Medical Procedure Skills Training

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical procedures and anatomical knowledge
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented environment using medical simulation equipment, with access to learning materials and formative assessments via personal BYOD devices

learning_goals: Learners can perform core steps of complex medical procedures (e.g., endoscopy) with 90% accuracy within six months
Learners' self-confidence scores, measured via a self-efficacy survey, improve to 7 points or higher (out of 10)
Learners can complete target procedures (e.g., reaching the appendix) within an average of 5 minutes in a simulation environment
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
